intro: Polyspora papuana, commonly known as the Papuan polyspora, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Papua, Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Polyspora papuana is often found in shaded, humid environments and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
